movie_title: A Question to Ask Ourselves When We Are Low and Paranoid
introduction: There’s a difficult mood we’re in danger of falling into that’s made up of four elements in particul

vocabulary.definition: a mental condition characterized by delusions of persecution, unwarranted jealousy, or exaggerated self-importance
vocabulary.example: In her paranoia, she believed that everyone was talking about her behind her back.

vocabulary.definition: easily annoyed or provoked to anger
vocabulary.example: After a long day at work, he becomes irritable and snaps at his colleagues.

vocabulary.definition: something suppressed or removed that is considered objectionable or harmful
vocabulary.example: The government censored the controversial scenes in the movie before allowing it to be released.
She was livid when she found out her project had been sabotaged.

vocabulary.definition: in the process of coming into being or becoming prominent
vocabulary.example: The emergent technology promises to revolutionize the industry.

vocabulary.definition: in every case or on every occasion; always
vocabulary.example: He invariably arrives late to every meeting, regardless of the time.
